edu.stanford.math.nebtda
Class BoundaryLoop

java.lang.Object
  edu.stanford.math.nebtda.Boundary
      edu.stanford.math.nebtda.BoundaryLoop

public class BoundaryLoop
extends Boundary

Implements the boundary of a 2-cell as a piecewise linear loop.

Author:
Henry Adams, Atanas Atanasov

followGeodesic

public VectorDouble followGeodesic(VectorDouble point,
                                   VectorDouble tangent)
Moves a point along a geodesic in the boundary. If the point is not in the boundary loop, then it is first moved to the nearest location in the loop.

Specified by:
followGeodesic in class Boundary
Parameters:
point - initial point on the boundary
tangent - initial direction to move
Returns:
result after moving along a geodesic in the boundary

projectTangent

public VectorDouble projectTangent(VectorDouble point,
                                   VectorDouble vector)
Projects a vector to the tangent space of the boundary. If the base point is not in the boundary loop, then it is first moved to the nearest location in the loop.

Specified by:
projectTangent in class Boundary
Parameters:
point - point on the boundary
vector - vector
Returns:
vector projected to the tangent space of the boundary at the point

movePointAndGetSegment

public int movePointAndGetSegment(VectorDouble point)
Moves the point to the nearest location in the loop, and gets the segment index of that location.

Parameters:
point - point on the boundary
Returns:
segment index

public VectorDouble computeAvgCenter()
Computes the average of the points defining the loop.
